intro: Galatella villosula, commonly known as the hairy galatella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Galatella villosula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
